body:
> \u000a

That did not work like ctrl-J

> Which obviously would not work.

Did you actually try it? The migrated config is correct.
That's a bug due to us routing the `Esc` bindings via the `paste` function and we force replace `\r` to `\n` in it, thus the config is correct, but we not allow it anymore.

> > Which obviously would not work.
> 
> Did you actually try it? The migrated config is correct.

I have tried all mentioned variants. Unchanged toml did not work

> That's a bug due to us routing the `Esc` bindings via the `paste` function and we force replace `\r` to `\n` in it, thus the config is correct, but we not allow it anymore.

Was that intended? Will you fix it? Can I set some flag in yml config so it keeps using it without warnings?

>  Can I set some flag in yml config so it keeps using it without warnings?

Ignore that. Even if I ignore warning, v13 does not work with yml
Ok feel free to close it if you do not want to fix. I have moved on to `\u000b`(ctrl+K) which is ok for me (workaround to use shift+enter for the apps that do not support that like fzf)

issue.title: Don't substitute `\n` in char bindings
issue.body:
This broke unintentionally due to routing paste-like input via paste function.

Fixes #7476.

--

This is probably how it should be, since `bracketed` is just a request to check, and if fail to substitute, since it intended to paste and not write raw input.
